Question: What is the formula for  %age complete
What is the future value of $50,000 invested for 7 years at 12 percent?
Note:
[Qno: PML_268] >> FV= Present Value x (1+ rate/100)^years
FV = 50,000 x (1.12) ^ 7

Question: Which of the following is not part of risk management plan?

A team is responsible for identification of opportunities for the project that arise from organizational strength. It also identifies opportunities from the threats arising from organizational weaknesses. What this team is doing?
Note: [Qno: PML_380] >> In SWOT (Strength, Weakness, Opportunity & Threat) analysis, you convert your weakness into strengths and convert your threat into opportunities.

Question: Last week your team was performing qualitative risk analysis for your project. As a result the risks identified are grouped by categories. Now you are not able to locate that information. What is the right place for updating that information.?

Within one week of project scope statement baseline customer comes to and mentions that frozen requirements does not support our newly changed marketing strategy therefore contract need to be amended. After this change is evaluated and you found substantial change in cost and schedule which has been approved by customer. What is your next step?

Answers: Cost and Schedule has been approved by the customer therefore do nothing
Adjust your baselines as per newly approved cost and schedule.

Question: Sponsor decided that although all will participate to give input but only Jim will make the decision. Which decision making technique is this?
You are the project manager of a multi billion dollar IT project. Which of the following Tools Techniques will you use to develop the risk management plan?

One of your team member is testing parts. After she have tested 60 parts out of 100 she was informed that there is 1 % probability of defect in those 100 parts. Now what is the probability of defect in remaining 40 parts. No defect was identified by her till now.
Note: [Qno: PML_412] >> Probability is still 1 %. It cannot be 100 % because it is not certain event.

Question: A discipline deals with interdisciplinary field of engineering that focuses on how complex engineering projects should be designed and managed over the life cycle of the project.
Which tool you will use to create Risk Management Plan?
To perform active risk acceptance what should be done?

Answers: Develop a plan to minimize impact so that if an identified risk occurs impact can be reduced.
Develop a plan to minimize the probability of occurrence for identified risks.
Create contingency reserves in resources, money and time.
Make additional resources available to speed up the project.

Question: The Scope baseline consists of

Answers: Cost baseline, Quality baseline and Schedule baseline
Scope statement, WBS, and WBS dictionary
Configuration management plan and Configuration identification document
Procurement statement of work and Project scope statement

Question: Your customer expects you to implement a minor scope change without delay and without additional cost. You believe that you have adequate authorization to make the decision by yourself, but you are not quite sure about this. What should be your next steps

Answers: Handle the request according to the integrated change control processes described in your management plans. Then make a decision together with the appropriate change control body, whether the increased customer satisfaction will be worth the extra costs, work, risks etc.

Customer satisfaction is your top priority. Customer gives you opportunity for this. This is the opportunity to exceed the expectations. So ahead and make up the cost from contingency buffer. After all this is for these kind of situations.
Look into the opportunity and try to exploit it for further profit maximization
This is good opportunity to develop relations so go ahead and start working on this, after all this is minor scope change.

Question: A WBS dictionary has

Answers: List of deliverables & their dictionary meaning

Question: Where should you write the product acceptance criteria?
The Scope baseline includes____.

Answers: Details of scope management plans of the project
Configuration Management Plan and Statement of work

Question: What is the meaning of the acronym CSOW?

Answers: Statement of work - part of contingency plan
Currently valid statement of work, which should be used for comparison with other versions of SOW
Statement of work that is directly linked to Control account
Formally agreed statement of work part of the contract

Question: During Risk identification sessions, you and your team identified more than 100 risks for your project. You couldn’t sleep that night because the amount of time and energy required to make risk response plan for these risks is not available with you. You PMP friend suggested you that you should -------

Answers: Use Qualitative risk analysis in order to prioritize risks for further action, such as Quantitative risk analysis.
Assess the probability of each risk qualitatively and further analyze only those risks with high probability.
Assess the potential impact of each risk qualitatively and further analyze only those risks with high impact.
Identify Risk triggers wherever possible. Develop risk response plan only for those risks for which no trigger could be found.

Question: In in your recent observation you sensed a slightly negative attitude in your team. Which of the following document is NOT used to understand and improve the situation.
You identified a technical risk in your project and assigned a contingency plan for that. Planning contingency reserves is -----
Which of these is not required for establishing cost performance baseline?

Answers: The Risk breakdown structure and the Risk register.

Question: In your project you have identified all the possible risks, developed risk response plan, risk owners are identified for each risk, contingency reserves allocated in your cost performance baseline even after that project is facing lot many hiccups. What may be the problem?

Answers: You failed to develop Risk Breakdown Structure
You have not identified risk triggers
You have not calculated EMV of each risk
You are not monitoring & controlling risks

Question: Which option is most relevant for a 360 degree review?

Answers: Assessments from different perspectives leave no weak spot of a person unaddressed.
The reviewed person will regard the assessment process as fair and developmental.
Managers will be assessed by their subordinates, enforcing a more participative style.
One can use a simple standard questionnaire to gather data from the reviewers.

Question: A difference between a Statement of work and a Scope statement is:

Answers: The statement of work focuses on physical or technical matters, while the project scope statement focuses on a functional view.
The statement of work is prepared by the customer while the scope statement is developed by the project management team.
The project scope statement is in most projects developed before the statement of work is written.
A project scope statement can become a contract document; a statement of work cannot.

Question: You are the manager of a project for a company that is known to make heavy use of extrinsic motivators in order to boost morale and team performance. What does that mean?

Answers: Extrinsic motivators are tailored to the needs of individual team members.
Extrinsic motivators are derived from within individual team members.
Extrinsic motivators include the improvement of hygiene factors of the work environment.
Extrinsic motivators are incentives such as rewards, gifts, or money.

Question: You are running a project which was budgeted based on some Rough order of magnitude (ROM) estimates with a precision of -25% / +75%. While working, when some deliverables are in progress, on the project you found out that these estimates were consistently too low and the budget will not be sufficient to successfully run and finish the project. What should you do?

Answers: You shouldn’t worry too much, It is quite normal that early estimates are too optimistic and later estimates are too pessimistic but the project costs will finally settle somewhere in between.
Find a contractor who can run the project for you. Set the budget as a price limit during the bidding process and accept only Firm fixed price (FFP) offers which do not exceed this price.
Try to reduce scope and use cheaper material in areas wherever possible in the project. It is not your responsibility that an insufficient budget has been created for the project.

Bring the issue to your sponsor and discuss how this should be handled. Together with the sponsor develop some guidelines and adhere to the guidelines which describe how budgets will be reviewed and refined periodically.

Question: Your portfolio has the choice between several projects it could run. But you have limited resource. In order to select projects, the organization assessed their strategic importance, investment requirements, and expected cash inflow from the projects’ products, services and results. What should the organization assess in addition?
Note: [Qno: PML_678] >> In portfolio level decision making focus should be on benefits from the outcome of the project, business goal alignment, ensure cashflow for the project.

Answers: The probability of changes to strategic goals.
The probability of the expected cash inflows.
From what different sources the money is coming

Question: Most common cause of conflicts in a project is
Note: [Qno: PML_694] >> Schedules are most common cause of conflicts.

Question: Which one is not project selection method?
Which of the following is not true about the WBS report?
Note: [Qno: PML_720] >> WBS should focus on deliverables.

Answers: The project team must be involved in developing the WBS.
As a rule of thumb, each activity of WBS should take less than 80 hours.
WBS should focus in on the activities that must be performed in the project and should not focus on the deliverables.
WBS is usually represented in a hierarchical fashion.

Question: Which one represents order of magnitude estimates
Note: [Qno: PML_726] >> The order of magnitude is preferred during initiation phase, and it has an accuracy range of -25% to 75%. This range is 100% range.

Question: In your project you noticed that people can leave due to low morale and motivation. In this context low morale and motivation is an example of
Note: [Qno: PML_728] >> A risk trigger is an indication that the risk is about to occur or has occurred.

Question: You recently completed a project phase and decide to do one party with team members at weekend. Being long weekend you know that some of the people may not come but didn’t change your plan and went ahead with an assumption that probability is very low. This is an example of which risk response strategy?
Which of the following is true statement about risks?
Note: [Qno: PML_750] >> Only this is the only correct statement.

Answers: Risk identification happens in all the phases of the project.
Risk register has list of only expired risks
You should take action only when risk has occurred
A risk that was not planned but has happened is called a trigger.

Question: Which of the following is an output of the Identify Risks process.
Note: [Qno: PML_752] >> Risk Register is the only output of the Risk identification process.

Question: Which one the below process does not use Reserve Analysis tool & technique?
Note: [Qno: PML_793] >> Reserve analysis is used while you working on Estimate Costs process to calculate contingency buffers. Reserve analysis is also used during Determine Budget to calculate management contingency buffers that apply to the entire project. Reserve analysis is done during Activity Duration estimation in order to calculate duration buffers for individual activities.

Question: Project Cost Management Plan is created as a part of
Note: [Qno: PML_794] >> PMBoK does not have separate process in the Project Cost Estimation knowledge area to develop a cost management plan. It is developed in Develop Project Management Plan process.

Question: With triangular distribution, the low, likely and high values are 20, 30 and 40, respectively. The mean is _____.
Which is an input to human resource planning?
Note: [Qno: PML_809] >> Develop Human Resource Plan Inputs : Enterprise Environmental Factors, Historical information, Organizational Process Assets and Project Management plan.

Question: What is not among the tools and techniques of Organizational Planning?
Note: [Qno: PML_818] >> Staffing Management Plan (part of Human Resource Plan) is output of Develop Human Resource Plan

Question: Control Costs is concerned with:
Note: [Qno: PML_819] >> Control Costs is concerned with Managing changes when they occur

Question: Top down estimating is also called as.
Note: [Qno: PML_826] >> Analogous estimating uses the actual cost of a previous, similar project as the basis for estimating the cost of the project in hand.

Question: Which describes how cost variances will be managed?
Note: [Qno: PML_837] >> Cost management plan describes how cost variances will be managed.

Question: Which is controlling changes to the budget.
Note: [Qno: PML_847] >> Costs variations are monitored and controlled in Control Costs Process.

Question: How many and of what quality resources are required to perform project activities. This is called
Note: [Qno: PML_863] >> Resource planning :Planning, identifying, documenting, and assigning project roles, responsibilities, and reporting relationships to individuals or groups.

Question: Which Estimate Costs technique used most frequently in the early stages of a project.
Note: [Qno: PML_864] >> Analogous estimating is also called top-down estimating and uses the actual cost of a previous, similar project as the basis for estimating the cost of the project in hand

Question: What is the standard deviation for the estimates. Optimistic= $50, Pessimistic=$70, Most Likely= $55
While estimating Activity Duration what do you not want to look into
Note: [Qno: PML_904] >> Activity cost estimates are input for determine budget.

Question: Which is not part of the Earned Value calculations ?
Note: [Qno: PML_918] >> Unknown Unknowns in project are managed using management reserve. They are not part of cost performance baseline therefore not part of earned value calculations

Question: Change requests are made against ----
Note: [Qno: PML_927] >> All change requests are made against a project plan that has the project baseline.

Question: Change requests should be ______ ?
Note: [Qno: PML_928] >> Record of changes request should be maintained by project team and change request can be raised by any stakeholder.

Question: Which is a valid response to positive risks?
Note: [Qno: PML_932] >> Positive risks may be responded by - "Exploit", "Enhance", "Share", "Accept".

Question: Which is a valid response to negative risks?
Note: [Qno: PML_933] >> Risk mitigation is a response to negative risks.

Question: Which performance measurement tells you that how much more  money is required to finish the project?
Note: [Qno: PML_937] >> Estimate to completion calculates how much more of the budget is needed to complete the project.

Question: A Pareto diagram can be best described as:
Note: [Qno: PML_959] >> Pareto diagram mainly helps the project management team to address maximum issues with minimum efforts

Question: If the Earned Value is equal to Actual Cost, What does it means:
Note: [Qno: PML_970] >> Cost Variance = EV - AC . Therefore if EV = AC, the Cost Variance is zero .

Answers: Project is on budget and on schedule

Question: Which of the following is NOT true regarding Risk Management Plan?
Note: [Qno: PML_991] >> Risk register is updated when trigger for risk occurs.

Risk Management Plan will be updated when the trigger for a major risk occurs
Risk Management Plan includes the categories of risk, their definition and Definition of risk probability and impact
Plan Risk Management is an input to all the remaining Risk Planning processes

Question: Which of the following is true regarding Control Account?

Answers: It is the body with overall administrative authority and control over an account in the performing organization
It is a quality control tool for controlling the defects to minimize delivered defects
It is the major accounting book where all the cost details are entered for an active account
It is a management control point where scope, budget, actual cost and schedule are integrated and compared to earned value for performance management

Question: Which of the following is true about accuracy and precision?
Note:
[Qno: PML_1004] >> Accuracy means that measured value is very close to the True value. Precision means the value of repeated measurement have very little scatter. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition Page190
Speed of the printer is 50 pages per minute but our measurement shows that it is 49.5 pages per minute. Some times printer prints 40 PPM sometimes it prints 60 PPM although the average is 49.5 which is very near to acclaimed speed (high accuracy) but data is scattered and precision is very wide (low precision)

Answers: Precision is correctness and accuracy is consistency
Precision is consistency and accuracy is correctness
Precision is used for measuring length and accuracy is used for time measurements

Question: You are the project manager for a project that has high visibility. Your manager wants you to prepare a presentation for him to present at a conference. What is the best option for you?
Note: [Qno: PML_1006] >> There are other better ways. But given the options, option #2 is the best.

Answers: Refuse to work on the presentation unless you are listed as a co-author.
Do the work as you were told by your manager.
Meet with your manager’s manager and discuss the problem.

Question: Which of the following statements is false

Scope Verification is primarily concerned with Acceptance of the deliverables
Quality control is generally performed before Scope Verification
If the project is terminated early, the scope verification is not necessary.

Using process analysis technique of QA

Question: Team development training cost is of what type of cost?

For threat, the high risk zone offers greatest benefits
For opportunities, the high risk zone offers greatest benefits
For threat the low risk zone should be addressed first

Question: Which of the following statement is NOT true?

Requested changes is an output of Scope Verification
Work Performance information is an input to Scope control

Question: Which of the following types of power is the most effective in leading teams?
Note: [Qno: PML_1255] >> The most effective type of power for a project manager is Expert power. Your team respects you because they know that you are expert on the subject we are discussing about

Question: You are working on a project with 7 engineers, 1 architect. While you are in execution phase 2 more joins your team for quality control activities. How many new communication channel opens.
Note: [Qno: PML_1264] >>  The formula for lines of communication is n x (n-1) / 2. In beginning team size is 9 people it has increased to 11 people. Therefore in beginning there are 36 communication channels, after new member join there are 55 communication channel. Thus 55-36 = 19 new communication channels opens

Question: Amit is the manager of a software project. His client has agreed on a Project Scope Statement at the beginning of the project, but whenever the client verifies deliverables, he comes up with features that he would like to add into the product. Amit is working with the client to find what requirements were missed in the planning stages of the project and how to plan better in the future. This is an example of
Note: [Qno: PML_1295] >> The project’s scope is changing every time the client is asked to verify the product—that’s scope creep.

Question: Which of the following BEST describes when you perform the Monitor and Control Project Work process?
Note: [Qno: PML_1308] >>  One of the most important things that you do as a project manager is to constantly monitor the project for changes, and take the appropriate action whenever you make a change. But changes don’t happen on any sort of schedule—if they did, it would make project management a whole lot easier! That means you need to continuously monitor your project to figure out whether or not its plans and scope need to change.

Answers: As soon as any deliverable is ready
At scheduled milestones or predefined intervals during the project
At the end of every project phase

Question: Which of the following is NOT an output of Monitor & Control Project Work?
Note: [Qno: PML_1309] >> Change Requests, Project Management Plan Updates, Project Docs Updates are output of Monitor & Control Project Work

Question: Change request has been approved by change control board now these will be implemented in which process?
Note: [Qno: PML_1321] >> Changes are identified in Monitor and Control Project Work process; they are approved in Perform Integrated Change Control, and implemented in Direct and Manage Project Execution.

Question: Who creates the scope baseline?
Note: [Qno: PML_1347] >> Stakeholders can give input but scope baseline should be created by Project Team.

Question: You received an audit report from your quality audit team. This report has identified that few critical process are out of control. After this you call your project team to discuss the course of action. What describe the situation best
Note: [Qno: PML_1348] >> Out-of-control situations are identified as a part of Perform Quality Assurance, and change request goes as an corrective action input to Quality Control process. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 206

Answers: You would be performing quality assurance actions
Perform quality control and revalidate the out of control process
You are performing quality assurance activities, analyzing cause of variation and identifying change requests required
You would be performing quality control activities, analyzing cause of variation and identifying change requests required

While one of the members of the negotiating team on the buyer’s side has been very helpful in establishing reasonable terms, the buyer’s negotiating partner has challenged every point put forth in the meeting by your team, stating you are ‘brain damaged’. Note: [Qno: PML_1355] >> Another Example: A husband and wife go out to buy laptop. He acts in an aggressive and dominant way, complaining about the price and the sales person’s condescending manner. She takes the sales person aside and apologizes for her husband and whispers a price at which she thinks he will buy.

Question: What are the five phases of the Tuckman model in order?
Note: [Qno: PML_1374] >>  This defines the correct sequence: forming, storming, Norming, performing, adjourning. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 233

Question: To know about the stability of a process you use statistical process control chart with UCL & LCL. What is standard UCL/LCL limit in the control chart.?
Note: [Qno: PML_1379] >>  The SPC chart sets upper and lower control limits at +/- 3 sigma. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 196

Question: The stakeholder analysis matrix is part of what process?
Note: [Qno: PML_1383] >> It is part of the Stakeholder Management Strategy which is output of Identify Stakeholders. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 251

Question: Quality policies and standards are established in
Note: [Qno: PML_1404] >>  Quality policies and standards are established in the Plan Quality process. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, pp. 192-194

Question: What percentage of the message contained in email is actually understood by the recipients?
Note: [Qno: PML_1423] >> Albert Mehrabian showed in his Paralingual studies that only 7% of the message is contained in the words. 38% is contained in the vocal pitch and tone, 55% is contained in the body language is understood by the people.

Question: In one interview you asked a potential project manager that "What is the purpose of the initiating process group?” What is the best reply?

Answers: Initiating can kick off the project or a phase of the project
In initiating phase you write contract
Initiating identifies the project manager and produces a project charter

Question: You joined an organization and while scanning through the organizational process assets you come to know that huge number of projects are failing in the organization. When you search for charter of these projects you come to know that no single project has the project charter available. This week you have been placed on a high value project and you told your management that first I need to work on the elements of project charter. Management feel that it is waste of time to write that useless paper. How do you convince your management.
Note: [Qno: PML_1453] >> You always want to show the stakeholder the effects of their actions/inactions. C and D are wrong - the PM does not take unilateral action unless authorized to do so by the organization. Answers like A are usually wrong - this is the equivalent of “I’m telling the teacher what you did!”

Answers: Tell PMI about a fundamental breach in the PMI framework
Refuse to take on the project as you know this will most likely result in a project failure
Continue to work on the charter with the project sponsor. So that you can show the benefit of project charter on the completion of project
Discuss the benefits of a well-defined project charter with senior management

Question: A variance analysis is used for:

In your project some of the team members thinks that team has put in extra efforts to ensure quality and timely delivery in the project. As a project manager you agreed and decided to return the favor in terms of doing some out door activity for the team and allowed comp off for working on the non-working days. These two are examples of
Note: [Qno: PML_1462] >> Perk: giving non financial award which improve the quality of life. Fringe benefits: something like part of your salary but given occasionally or spending on behalf of employee, like medical insurance, deposit in pension fund by employer etc. Team building is an all-team activity. Entitlement award is made for some individual.

Question: Senior management has received progress reports on the current project you are managing. It seems that one of the technical team member has done an outstanding job of delivering certain aspects of the product in development, and management has taken notice. The fundamental difference between Effective communication and Efficient communication means that:
Note: [Qno: PML_1534] >> Effective communication means that the information is provided in the right format, at right time, and with the right impact. Efficient communication means providing only the information that is needed. On most project communication planning is done in early phases of the project therefore to check the efficiency of communication plan one should review it from time to time. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p. 252

Answers: Effective communications ensure the guaranteed delivery of the communication and Efficient communications provide information to only the stakeholders who need it
Effective communications focus on the fastest communication channel  and Efficient communications focus on the most appropriate communication channel
Effective communications ensure the timeliness and the format of the communications and Efficient communications provide only the information that is needed
Effective communications are required and Efficient communications are optional

Question: The project team has collected a series of issues and ranked them by frequency for process improvement. What tool or technique is used to plot data in ranked order?
Note: [Qno: PML_1537] >> Pareto chart is used to plot the ranked data. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, p 210-211

Question: Strategic plans related to quality of project, types of project organization should undertake is under the purview of
One of the critical factors in implementing the quality plan is

Answers: Implement quality improvements as long as the benefits more than the cost of implementation
Invoice the client for all quality related activities
Implement the highest possible quality possible regardless of time it takes
You cannot do anything if top management is delaying approval of your quality budget.

Question: Primary outputs from team development are:
Note: [Qno: PML_1650] >> Team performance assessment is output of Develop Project Team and this is used as input in Manage Project Team for performance appraisal purpose.

Root Cause Analysis is related to
Note: [Qno: PML_1739] >> While doing process analysis you also do the root cause analysis to know the reason of variance in any process

Question: Which of the following options is not used for assessing the completion of the project scope.
Note: [Qno: PML_1754] >> The product requirements are the basis for assessing the completion of the PRODUCT scope. Remaining all are used to verify the project scope.

Question: Which process in integration management uses inputs from the largest number of  other PMBoK processes?
Note: [Qno: PML_1761] >> “Develop Project Management Plan” integrates for all other processes in the planning group. Every planning process therefore  provides input to this process.

Question: Which of the following is not true about error in project quality management?

Error is a reflection of inadequate project planning.

Note: [Qno: PML_1772] >> The product description is generally broader that a statement of work. [12.1.1.2]

Exceeding customer expectations through gold plating.

Question: The sender of a message is responsible for:

Presenting the message in the most agreeable manner

Define project scope and develop WBS

Analyze successes, shortfalls of current projects

Justify results, set standards of current projects

Question: Acquire Project team process is part of …
Which of the following process generates Roles & Responsibilities :
Note: [Qno: PML_1980] >> Roles & Responsibilities are part of Human Resource Plan. PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition Page-217

Question: Manage Stakeholders Expectations is a part which of the following knowledge area

Alan was working with a service delivery company and he recently joined a product development company. Here he notices that the work is being managed in a very different way. The products have scheduled releases and all the project managers are managing individual product releases of a software product along with co-ordination of these releases over time. The following best describes this situation:

Answers: This is project management , they are working using agile methodology
This is operations management. Since this is ongoing activity in the organization.
This is portfolio management since each product release is a program in itself.
This is program management since each release is separate project and individual project’s release impacts the product release.

Question: In a basic communication model what is not expected?
Note: [Qno: PML_2023] >> Receiver may disagree as well.

Answers: Receiver should agree with the message sent by the sender.
Receiver must decode and reply to the message.
Receiver should send a feedback message to the sender.

Question: As a project manager, you do not take any major project decision without the involvement of team. As a leader you This style of leadership is

You are managing a project in a foreign country, where you have to pay a fee to a government agencies to get your work done. In this case you should.
Note: [Qno: PML_2056] >> PM has the responsibility to refrain from offering or accepting inappropriate payments, gifts, or other forms of compensation for personal gain. But if it is conforming to the culture and law of that country then do the needful but you inform to your manager & sponsor

Answers: Refuse to pay the fee, because they are bribes and hence unethical
Make a case why fees should be paid to government agencies, and present it to your management
Pay the fee to the government agencies
Offer gifts to the government officials instead of fee to get their support

Question: In a normal distribution, standard deviation refers to:

Distance of measurement from the middle most value
Distance of measurement from the mean

Note: [Qno: PML_2145] >> New risk or secondary risk or residual risk may get triggered in monitoring and controlling of the project. But initial identification happens in planning phase only.

This week you have been assigned trouble project, where schedule is 50% behind the plan and project manager has left the organization. After evaluation, you discovered that the project is running far behind schedule the schedule then reported by previous project manager. Answers: Add new resource to the project and complete the project on schedule.
Show your finding and evaluation to sponsor.
Ask your senior manager to deal with this.
Turn the project back to the previous project manager.

Question: You have been assigned as the project manager in the middle of the project but the customer is not happy with the performance of the project. What is the FIRST thing you should do?

Answers: Under the performance criteria from the project plan and achieve those
Talk to customer and understand his concerns.
Ignore the customer, it is bound to happen sometimes in project lifecycle.
Leave the project and ask your manager to assign another project.

Question: Why should quality be planned and not inspected every time?

To improve quality with less cost
To reduce quality with less cost
To reduce quality with more cost

Question: Which of these is not organizational process assets
A program is which one of the following?
Note:
[Qno: PML_2434] >> A is incorrect because programs are not made up of just small projects.
B is incorrect because a program is a collection of projects, not just one large complex project.
C is incorrect since projects with a common customer do not necessitate a program.

Answers: A collection of small projects with a common goal
A collection of subprojects with a common customer
A collection of projects with a common cause

Question: Statement of work can be available in all document except
The amount of time a task can be delayed without delaying the start date of immediate next activity is called

You applied three-point estimation on a Critical path which consists of three activities. The following duration uncertainties are all calculated assuming a ±3sigma Confidence interval. The duration uncertainty estimates of the first activity is 10 days; the second activity’s duration uncertainty estimates is 15 days and the same of third activities is 18 days. Applying the PERT formula for paths, what is the duration uncertainty of the entire path?
Note: [Qno: PML_2817] >> Entire Path Duration Uncertainty Estimate = Square root of  sum of square of all uncertainty estimates = SQRT(10^2 + 15^2 +18^2)= SQRT(649) = 25.49
